thread.title: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil responds after claims he's set to be dropped for Bayern Munich clash | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil responds after claims he's set to be dropped for Bayern Munich clash | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil responds after claims he's set to be dropped for Bayern Munich clash | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us Mesut Ozil insists ‘we are ready’ after reports he’s set to be dropped for Champions League clash with Bayern Munich Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 4:47 pm Mesut Ozil could be dropped for Arsenal’s clash against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil insists the Gunners are ‘ready’ for their last-16 Champions League clash with Bayern Munich despite reports claiming he’s set to be dropped for the game. 
Arsene Wenger is believed to be toiling with the idea of dropping the attacking midfielder for the Gunners’ first leg with the Bundesliga giants. 
The 28-year-old’s been in poor form in recent weeks and Wenger admitted after Saturday’s 2-0 win against Hull that Ozil was low on confidence. 
It remains to be seen whether Wenger will drop Ozil for the game at the Allianz Arena but the German sent a message to his 14.3million Twitter followers on Tuesday by insisting the Gunners were ‘ready’ for the clash. 
— Mesut Özil (@MesutOzil1088) February 14, 2017 More
